summary: Tammany Hall was a powerful political organization in New York City, active from the late 18th century to the mid-20th century. It started as the Tammany Society in 1786 and became a key part of the Democratic Party. Tammany helped Irish immigrants gain political power and controlled local politics for many years. They supported immigrants and the working class but were also known for corruption and graft. The organization declined after losing influence to Franklin D. Roosevelt and facing opposition from Democratic leaders. Tammany Hall officially ended in the 1960s.
title: Tammany Hall
